name: Rubicon 2004
description:
‘*Elegant but not insubstantial, 04 is Chris Williams’s debut with long-time Cape icon. 64% Cabernet Sauvignon; Merlot, Cabernet Franc. Silk rather than brocade; blackcurrant, raspberry notes deliver harmony, length and balance. 2 yrs oak, 80% new. Deserves cellaring.’* – Platter’s SA Wine Guide 2009, 4.5☆


‘*Concentrated and grippy, with dark, roasted plum, black licorice, charcoal, mesquite and bittersweet cocoa notes. Traditional in vein, with an iron- and earth-filled finish that should soften nicely with cellaring. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc.*’ – 90/100 Wine Spectator (2008)

 The wines will continue to be cellared at the Meerlust vintage cellar until maturity (estimated 2028) or withdrawal. Rubicon is not produced every year. If a vintage is not produced, the NFT will include the next vintage, to total 50 consecutive vintages
